comments:
This course aims to provide students with a “marketable skill” by focusing on management and technical issues surrounding the development of computer programs for business. The class includes instruction on C++, Visual Studio.Net, and Microsoft.Net framework, but centers on management issues.

Overall, students really seemed to like this course. One said “it allows one to see the possibilities of using technology when making decisions at a firm.” Many thought it was a great class that builds on OPIM 101.

Students had great things to say about Professor Kimbrough. He is able to relate to students of all different ability levels in a course subject where there is a wide variety of aptitude. “Professor Kimbrough does an excellent job of teaching the course material in an understandable manner.”

Some students thought that the course had a very steep learning curve. Nevertheless, another student wrote that “it’s an easy A” for anyone with prior experience.
